title: 3D printed, hand assembled quartz watch
tag: Using a Markforged 3D printer, I created a watch from scratch featuring a fully 3D printed case and strap
description: I created the 3D model for this project in Fusion360, and the final case was printed using the Markforged Mark Two. The watch itself consists of the outer case, a screw-in back, and stock watch pieces (the internal movement of the watch, a separate crown, the watch face, hour and minute hands, and a domed mineral crystal).

title: Elephant card
tag: Using a hand sculpted 3D model, I created a two-dimensional piece that can be cut apart and re-assembled into a three-dimensional elephant
description: For this project, I chose an older 3D model that I sculpted on a Wacom tablet to be 3D printed. By repurposing this model, I made a version that could either be printed in thin layers, or laser cut as a flat object. The final product is the size of a credit card. After being laser cut or printed , the flat piece can be cut apart and slotted together to make an elephant.

title: Seasons
tag: A high resolution, low-poly piece that represents the changing seasons in a small amount of space
description: I worked on this project over the summer after my senior year to continue developing my skills in 3DS Max. Using a low-poly style that I had grown to love, I created an animated representation of each of the four seasons. These four sections were contained within the same scene, and a few incorporated different physics and particle effects that I had experimented with.
